alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Logan; Sheridan; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 11:21PM CDT until June 17 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Graham County in northwestern Kansas... Sheridan County in northwestern Kansas... Southeastern Thomas County in northwestern Kansas... Gove County in west central Kansas... Eastern Logan County in west central Kansas... * Until 315 AM CDT. * At 1121 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oakley, Hill City, Hoxie, Quinter, Grainfield, Grinnell, Gove, Selden, Morland, Bogue, Monument, Park, Menlo, Seguin, Angelus, Tasco, Studley, Saint Peter, Penokee and The Monument Rocks. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
